clinical_study.brief_title: AQUAPed: Validation Study of AQUA© Questionnaire Modified for Childhood
clinical_study.official_title: AQUAPed: Validation Study of AQUA© Questionnaire Modified for Childhood

lead_sponsor.agency: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

clinical_study.source: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

brief_summary.textblock: The AQUA© questionnaire developed in 2008 is a validated tools for the screening of allergic diseases in adult athletes. The objective of the present study is to develop and validate a modified version of the AQUA© questionnaire to be used in childhood. In this phase, the validation is intended to assess the reliability of the information collected through the AQUA© modified version: question difficulty and response patterns with respect to children characteristics (in particular age, sex and physical activity). In particular, the focus will be on the "core questions", i.e. the indicators of allergic disorders. This is a cross-sectional study on 248 healthy schoolchildren aged 8 to 14 years.

primary_outcome.description: Comprehensibility (or difficulty) of the questions, especially the "core questions", will be assessed by the percentages of non-response possibly stratified by children characteristics (in particular age, sex and physical activity).

secondary_outcome.description: Possible tendency to skip consecutive questions will be assessed by studying the association between the presence of missing (0 = answer missing, 1 = answer given) in sequence (tetrachoric correlation).
Analysis of the distribution of non-missing responses, possibly stratified by children characteristics (in particular age, sex and physical activity).

arm_group.description: There is only one study group consisting of 248 children recruited at school.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of 248 healthy schoolchildren, both males and females, aged 8 to 14 years, recruited in 7 primary and secondary schools of the city of Palermo.
